benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/cache - Invalidates the given Cache if specified, otherwise invalidates all caches

covered: Valid deletion (all caches and specific cache): TC01 and TC02 verify DELETE behaviour and 204 responses.
Non-existent / not-alive cache errors: TC03 and TC04 exercise the 400 error cases and assert no invalidation.
Input validation and edge cases for cacheName: TC05 (empty), TC10 (very large), TC11 (special chars), TC15 (regression) cover many invalid-name scenarios.
Case-sensitivity: TC12 covers mixed-case name handling.
Authorization negative case: TC06 covers unauthenticated/invalid-token behaviour (401/403).
Server error handling: TC07 covers a 500 when the cache subsystem fails.
No-cache and unsupported query param behaviour: TC08 (no caches) and TC09 (extra query params) are present.
Performance & concurrency: TC13 (1000 caches performance) and TC14 (10 concurrent requests) cover scale and concurrency for global invalidation.
Background steps ensure the system, endpoint reachability, and admin authentication preconditions are considered.
gaps: Content-Type / response headers: Tests do not assert the documented "Produces: application/json" or other response headers for success and error responses.
Authenticated-but-not-admin role: No explicit test that an authenticated non-admin user receives the correct authorization error (explicit 403) versus unauthenticated 401.
Idempotency / sequence of deletes: No tests for repeated deletes (e.g., delete an existing cache then delete it again to verify subsequent response).
Specific-cache race conditions: Concurrency tests target global invalidation; missing targeted concurrent DELETEs for the same cacheName to exercise race conditions and deterministic error handling.
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for bursts/rate-limits (e.g., expected 429 handling) or system behaviour under extreme request rates.
HTTP method constraints: No tests asserting unsupported methods (GET/POST/PUT/PATCH) return 405 Method Not Allowed.
Error response schema: Error payload structure (JSON fields, codes, machine-readable error codes) and Content-Type for errors are not validated.
Cluster / distributed cache scenarios: No tests for partial availability or cross-node cache state in a clustered environment (partial failures, eventual consistency).
Unicode and additional boundary tests: Unicode/UTF-8 cacheName values and off-by-one length boundaries (e.g., max length - 1, max length + 1) are not covered beyond the single 1024-char test.
Soft-delete / persistence semantics: No tests confirm whether invalidation is transient vs permanent, or how cache entries behave post-invalidation (audit/logging not checked).
recommendations: Add assertions for response headers and Content-Type (application/json) on both 204 and error responses to match "Produces: application/json".
Add an explicit test for an authenticated user without admin privileges (expect 403) in addition to unauthenticated cases.
Add idempotency tests: delete a cache, then delete it again and assert the API behaves per contract (document expected status for repeat deletes).
Introduce targeted concurrency tests that issue concurrent DELETEs for the same cacheName to validate race conditions and consistent error responses.
Add rate-limiting / throttling tests (burst of requests) to validate behaviour under high request rates and verify 429 or graceful degradation if applicable.
Add method-not-allowed tests to verify unsupported HTTP methods return 405.
Validate error response JSON schema and fields (error code, message, timestamp) for all error scenarios to ensure client-parsable errors.
If the system runs clustered, add tests for partial node failures and multi-node invalidation consistency.
Add Unicode/UTF-8 and boundary (off-by-one) tests for cacheName length and encoding to catch encoding/validation bugs.
If required by non-functional requirements, add assertions for audit/log entries or metrics emitted when caches are invalidated.
